qas.question: I2a1b1 is typical of what populations?
I2a1b1 is found being highest where?
Haplogroup I2a2 is commonly found in what group of people?
Hg I2a2 was believed to have arisen where?
Who has split I2a2 into two clades?
What percentage of north-eastern Italians have I2a1b1?
How old is I2a1b1 calculated to be?

context: On the other hand, I2a1b1 (P41.2) is typical of the <a0_0>South Slavic populations<a0_0/>, being highest in <a1_0>Bosnia-Herzegovina<a1_0/> (<b5_0>>50%<b5_0/>). Haplogroup I2a2 is also commonly found in <a2_0>north-eastern Italians<a2_0/>. There is also a high concentration of I2a2a in the Moldavian region of Romania, Moldova and western Ukraine. According to original studies, Hg I2a2 was believed to have arisen in the <a3_0><b6_0>west Balkans<b6_0/><a3_0/> sometime after the <b7_0>LGM<b7_0/>, subsequently spreading from the Balkans through Central Russian Plain. Recently, <a4_0><b8_0>Ken Nordtvedt<b8_0/><a4_0/> has split I2a2 into two clades – N (northern) and S (southern), in relation where they arose compared to Danube river. He proposes that N is slightly older than S. He recalculated the age of I2a2 to be <b9_0>~ 2550 years<b9_0/> and proposed that the current distribution is explained by a Slavic expansion from the area north-east of the Carpathians.
